data.title: Hong Kong Football Thread II (R)
data.meta_description: [IMG] Zeshan Rehman has taken over as head coach of KC Southern District.
data.text:
I think Suburbia was referring to the senior team.

https://www.scmp.com/sport/hong-kon...ammed-legislative-council-its-poor-governance

HKFA slammed by Legislative Council for its ‘poor governance’

The Hong Kong Football Association has come under fire again for its poor governance, with Legislative Councillors slamming the association committee members for its continued absence from meetings for a period of up to four years.

Lots of criticism in there. Sometimes I do believe the HKFA are doing everything they can, but sometimes I think they are not really bothered.

You could say fire everyone and start over, but I wonder who would want the jobs? Very little pay and the people are very hard to please.

Now that Eastern have the deepest squad in the league, you knew that eventually some players would leave for playing time. The news today suggests that Tsang Kam To, Tse Long Hin, Wu Chun Ming. Lau Hok Ming, Yiu Ho Ming and Chen Hao Wei will all leave the club before the season restarts. In particular, Wu will be loaned back to his old club Pegasus.

http://paper.wenweipo.com/2020/05/26/SP2005260021.htm

Tai Po FC is in financial trouble (again). The latest news is that Tai Po FC will pull out of competing in the remaining matches of the season. That means only 6 clubs will compete for the 2019-20 HKPL title. Head coach Fung Hoi Man has already left the club.

The HKFA held a press conference today to clear the air about their recent corruption allegations....or at least, that was the plan. Instead, Pui Kwan Kay took the opportunity to express outrage at the whistle blower who disclosed to the media that Sam Bensleys actual credentials were different from those on his application.

What was more egregious was that Pui spent eight minutes railing against someone named Philip (probably Lap Lap) for circulating an email against the Premier League clubs that they should consider breaking away from the league and forming their own league without the HKFA's involvement.

So interestingly enough, the HKFA announced a U-23 and U-19 training squad from 1st June to 20th June even though the reason is not known considering that both sides failed to qualify for the next edition of the AFC U23 and U19 championships. Anyways, here are the list of players named for the training camp.

Hong Kong U23:

Goalkeepers:

WONG Tsz Ho (Best Union Yuen Long), LAW King Hei (Hong Kong Pegasus),

CHOY Tsz To (Kwoon Chung Southern), TSE Ka Wing (R&F),

CHIN Alex Palelei (Wofoo Tai Po)

Defenders:

LEUNG Yau Wai (CD Cova Piedade), CHEUNG Chun Hin Macro,

YIP Cheuk Man (Happy Valley), CHAN Hoi Pak Paco,

LAU Wing Sang Rinson (Kwoon Chung Southern), WONG Pun Wai (BC Rangers), CHENG See Chun, YANG Lok Hang

Midfielders:

WONG Chun Hin (Best Union Yuen Long), POON Pui Hin, WONG Chi Hong,

YUEN Sai Kit (Happy Valley), CHANG Hei Yin(Hong Kong Pegasus),

CHAN Shinichi (Kitchee), LAM Hin Ting, LAM Jordan Lok Kan (R&F),

KOT Chun Hey, POON King Chi Titus

Forwards:

CHU Wai Kwan (Happy Valley), LEE Oi Hin (Hong Kong Pegasus),

BUDDLE Sebastian Robert (Kitchee), CHENG Tsz Sum, SUN Ming Him (Wofoo Tai Po), CHOW Ka Lok Leo (Lee Man)

Hong Kong U19:

Goalkeepers:

LO Siu Kei (BC Rangers), NG Wai Him (Happy Valley), TAI Ting Hong (Lee Man), NGAN Ngo Tin (South China), WAN Michael

Defenders:

SO Dick On (Happy Valley), LAM Tsz Shan, YANG Tsz Pan (Wofoo Tai Po), CHAN Yun Tung, TONG Qiao Zhe George, WONG Chun, WONG Yat

Midfielders:

LAI Pui Kei, NG Ka Yeung, LAM Lok Yin Jerry, TANG In Chim, MOORE Henry Hills (Happy Valley),CHIU Wan Chun, HO Ka Chi (Hong Kong Pegasus), CHANG Kwong Yin, TONG Connor Hew Fung (Kitchee), CHENG Chun Wang Ryan (Kwoon Chung Southern), WONG Ho Chun (South China), YU Jesse Joy Yin

Forwards:

FUNG Tsz Hin Les (Chelsea Soccer School (HK)), CHEN Ngo Hin,

ICHIKAWA Sohgo (Kitchee), CHEUNG Chit Hang Adrian, LAU Ka Kiu

Source: Hong Kong Premier League Facebook - U23 & U19

Always been corrupt mate. It's just that thankfully – for now at least – there's an Audit Commission to hold them to account and shine a light on their corruption.

http://paper.wenweipo.com/2020/05/30/SP2005300009.htm

There is a debate on whether the 2020 AFC Cup has already begun, if it has, then Tai Po's withdrawal will not bring a replacement; but if it hasn't, the R&F FC, who has already secured a AFC Club license, then may get to replace Tai Po in Group I.
